<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 96, 90]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 823, 91]]<|/det|> The IGCSE class is investigating the effect of a load on a metre rule attached to a force <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 408, 121]]<|/det|> The apparatus is shown in Fig. 1.1. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[248, 131, 692, 390]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[443, 406, 509, 424]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 438, 875, 486]]<|/det|>

The rule is pivoted near one end at the 10.0cm mark. Near the other end, at the 90.0cm mark, the rule is attached to a forcemeter. A mass is hanging from the rule at a distance \(d\) from the pivot.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 500, 146, 517]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 500, 875, 548]]<|/det|>
A student moves the mass to a distance \(d = 70.0 \text{cm}\) from the pivot. He adjusts the height of the forcemeter until the rule is again horizontal. He records the reading \(F\) on the forcemeter.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 562, 875, 594]]<|/det|>

She observes the images of \(\mathsf{P}_1\) and \(\mathsf{P}_2\) through side \(\mathbf{CD}\) of the block so that the images of \(\mathsf{P}_1\) and \(\mathsf{P}_2\) appear one behind the other.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 320, 875, 370]]<|/det|>
She places two pins \(\mathsf{P}_3\) and \(\mathsf{P}_4\) between her eye and the block so that \(\mathsf{P}_3\) and \(\mathsf{P}_4\) and the images of \(\mathsf{P}_1\) and \(\mathsf{P}_2\), seen through the block, appear one behind the other. The positions of \(\mathsf{P}_3\) and \(\mathsf{P}_4\) are marked on Fig. 5.1.
